feed.subtitle: Just some things that come to my mind

entry.content: Just found some historic documents - my first blog posts from 2006, back then in the SAP Developer Network Blog: https://blogs.sap.com/tag/alexander-ilg/

entry.content: I am starting a new Salesforce/SAP integration project with Overcast today. SAP PM/MM/SD/FI with customer master, prices, sales orders, purchase orders, shipments, invoices, material, inventory and much more.
entry.summary: I am starting a new Salesforce/SAP integration project with Overcast today. SAP PM/MM/SD/FI with customer master, prices, sales orders, purchase orders, shipments, invoices, material, inventory and much more.

entry.title: SAP PM/CS Transactions
entry.content:
The following is a list of useful and frequently used transactions in the SAP modules PM (Plant Maintenance) and CS (Customer Service) that I just re-discovered in an old Google Site of mine.

Transaction Code Description
IW31 Create Work/Service Order
IW32 Edit Work/Service Order
IW33 Display Work/Service Order
IW37 Work/Service Order selection by operation
IW38 Work/Service Order selection
IW41 Create Order Confirmation
IW21 Create Notification
IW22 Edit Notification
IW23 Display Notification
IE01 Create Equipment
IE02 Edit Equipment
IE03 Display Equipment
IL01 Create Functional Location
IL02 Edit Functional Location
IL03 Display Functional Location
CL02 Create Class
CT04 Create Characteristics

It might help in the future.
entry.summary: The following is a list of useful and frequently used transactions in the SAP modules PM (Plant Maintenance) and CS (Customer Service) that I just re-discovered in an old Google Site of mine.

entry.content: What I have learned over the weekend: Setting up GitHub pages and installing, configuring and using Jekyll. Next step: Make the creation of new posts easier.
entry.summary: What I have learned over the weekend: Setting up GitHub pages and installing, configuring and using Jekyll. Next step: Make the creation of new posts easier.

entry.content: I don’t understand why SAP has not moved ABAP as their central technology into the SAP Cloud (or Business Technology Platform as it is called now). ABAP is truly special, powerful and great. Why not use that instead of Node.js and Java …
entry.summary: I don’t understand why SAP has not moved ABAP as their central technology into the SAP Cloud (or Business Technology Platform as it is called now). ABAP is truly special, powerful and great. Why not use that instead of Node.js and Java …
